DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Parent Proxy Age 8 To 12 Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value of a child's parental proxy-reported score on the PedsQL Measurement Model within the eight to twelve years of age category.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Parent Proxy Age 8 To 12 Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (pee-dee-AT-rik) Having to do with children._A generic concept reflecting concern with the modification and enhancement of life attributes, e.g., physical, political, moral and social environment; the overall condition of a human life._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)_A mother or a father; the immediate progenitor._A type of advance directive that gives a person (such as a relative, lawyer, or friend) the authority to make healthcare decisions for another person. It becomes active when that person loses the ability to make decisions for himself or herself._A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth._A number with no fractional part.::8_Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A number with no fractional part.::12

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Concepts.definition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Property.preferredName: Parent Healthcare Proxy Age Integer::8 To Integer::12 Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A mother or a father; the immediate progenitor.:A type of advance directive that gives a person (such as a relative, lawyer, or friend) the authority to make healthcare decisions for another person. It becomes active when that person loses the ability to make decisions for himself or herself.:A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.:A number with no fractional part.::8:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A number with no fractional part.::12:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A mother or a father; an immediate progenitor.

A type of advance directive that gives a person (such as a relative, lawyer, or friend) the authority to make healthcare decisions for another person. It becomes active when that person loses the ability to make decisions for himself or herself.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
